abstract.text: A high statistics data sample of the decays of K + mesons to three charged particles was accumulated by the OKA experiment in 2012 and 2013.
This allowed to select a clean sample of about 450 events with K + → π + π − π + γ decays with the energy of the photon in the kaon rest frame greater than 30 MeV.
The measured branching fraction of the K + → π + π − π + γ , with E * γ > 30 MeV is equal to (0.71 ± 0.05) × 10 −5 .
The measured differential branching fraction over photon energy is compared with the prediction of the chiral perturbation theory to O( p 4 ).
A search for an updown asymmetry of the photon with respect to the hadronic system decay plane is also performed.

body_text.text: Introduction
The present experimental status of K + → π + π − π + γ is rather meagre.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: It was observed in one experiment on statistics of 7 events [1].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The photon energies in these events were low, that did not allow to search for deviations from a simple QED process of photon emission.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The measured value of the K + → π + π − π + γ branching ratio [2] is (1.04 ± 0.31) × 10 −4 for E * γ > 5 MeV.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In the present analysis we have a possibility for more detailed study of this decay using larger data sample collected by the OKA experiment.

body_text.text: To the lowest order in an expansion in momenta and meson masses, this radiative decay is completely determined [7] by the non-radiative amplitude for K + → π + π − π + .

body_text.text: However, at next-to-leading order, a full-fledged CHPT calculation of nonleptonic weak amplitudes of O( p 4 ) is required.

body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: It is interesting to confront these results to the experimental data.

body_text.text: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

The OKA experiment makes use of a secondary hadron beam at the U-70 Proton Synchrotron of NRC "Kurchatov Institute" -IHEP, Protvino, with enhanced fraction of kaons obtained by RF-separation with Panofsky scheme [11].
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The OKA setup, Fig. 1, is a double magnetic spectrometer complemented by electromagnetic and hadron calorimeters and a Decay Volume.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The first magnetic spectrometer, consisting of the magnet M 1 and surrounding 1 mm pitch PC's (BPC (1Y ) , BPC (2Y,2X ) , BPC (3X,3Y ) , BPC (4X,4Y ) ) serves for the beam momentum measurement.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: It is supplemented by  [13], see the text for details two gas threshold Cherenkov countersČ 1 ,Č 2 for kaon identification and by beam scintillation counters

Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The 11 m long Decay Volume (DV) filled with helium contains 11 rings of guard system (GS).
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: To reinforce GS, a gamma detector (BGD), made of lead glass blocks located behind the DV is used as a veto at large angles, while low angle particles pass through a central opening.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The wide aperture spectrometric magnet, SM (S P40 A) , with a field integral of ∼ 1 Tm serves as a spectrometer for the charged decay products together with corresponding tracking chambers: 2 mm PC's (PC 1,...,8 ), 9 mm diameter straw tubes ST (1,2,3) and 30 mm diameter drift tubes DT 1,2 .
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The matrix hodoscope HODO (matri x) is composed of 252 scintillator tiles with WLS+SiPM readout.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: It is used in the trigger, improves time resolution and links x-y projections of a track.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: Two scintillation counters S bk1 , S bk2 serve to suppress undecayed beam particles.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: At the end of the OKA setup there are two calorimeters: electromagnetic (GAMS-2000) made of lead glass blocks and a hadron one (HCAL (G D A) ) -100 iron-scintillator sandwiches.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: Finally, four partially overlapping muon counters are located downstream the HCAL.
body_text.section: Separated kaon beam and OKA experiment

body_text.text: The data acquisition system of the OKA setup [12] operates at ∼ 25 kHz event rate with the mean event size of ∼ 4 kByte.

body_text.text: Event selection
To select K + → π + π − π + γ decay channel in off-line analysis a set of requirements is applied:
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: • the momentum of the beam track is required to be measured; • the number of the secondary charged tracks is required to be equal to three and the net charge of them is equal to +1; • the decay vertex should have good χ 2 and should be with a margin inside the DV; • the charged tracks are not identified as electrons in the GAMS-2000 electromagnetic calorimeter; • the missing mass squared to each positive pion M 2 miss (π + ) = (P K + − P π + ) 2 should be greater than 0.07 GeV 2 ;
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: • the event should contain one and only one photon with the energy E γ > 0.5 GeV; • the invariant mass of the photon with each pion (M(π γ )) should be greater than 0.17 GeV; • the square of the transverse momentum of the 3πγ system is less than 0.001 GeV 2 ; • the ratio of the momentum of the 3πγ system to the momentum of the beam track should be within the range 0.95-1.05.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: The cut on the square of the missing mass to each positive pion M 2 miss (π + ) is used for the suppression of the background from the decay K + → π + π 0 with π 0 → e + e − γ .
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: The main source of the background for the K + → π + π − π + γ decay is the decay of kaon to three charged pions when the pions produce hadron showers in the electromagnetic calorimeter and, because of fluctuations, a part of a shower is not associated with a charged track by the reconstruction program.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: To suppress such kind of background a cut on M(π γ ) is done.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: The reconstructed momentum of the 3πγ system should be equal to the momentum of the beam particle.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: This motivates the last two cuts listed above.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: For the illustration, the distributions of the square of the transverse momentum of the 3πγ system and the ratio of absolute value of its momentum to the momentum of the beam particle after all the previous cuts is shown in Figs. 2 and 3. The invariant mass distribution of the 3πγ system after application of all the cuts listed above is shown in Fig. 4. We see clear separation of the signal, peaking around the nominal value of the kaon PDG [2] mass and the background concentrating at higher masses.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: The number of events in the signal region is about 450.
body_text.section: Event selection

body_text.text: As almost all the photons in the selected K + → π + π − π + γ events have the energy in the kaon rest frame greater than 0.03 GeV, in the following analysis we apply an additional explicit cut E * γ > 0.03 GeV.

body_text.text: Conclusions
The decay K + → π + π − π + γ is studied on statistics of 450 events.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The measured branching fraction is Br(3πγ ) = (0.71 ± 0.05) × 10 −5 for E * γ > 0.03 GeV.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The differential branching fraction over photon energy is also determined.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The measured branching fractions agree well within the errors with the calculations in the framework of the chiral perturbation theory.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The measured up-down asymmetry of the photon with respect to the decay plane of the hadronic system is 0.03 ± 0.06.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: No sign of P and T-odd effects is observed within present statistics.
